column1: *Rows 3 and 4 are ignored on import.  We use these rows to describe the legal values for cells above and below.
column2:
*Type is very important.  
For Risks import, Type should be "Risks". (in cell A2)

column1:
*Required

If you have a standardized acronym or other specific reason for entering Codes manually, we recommend doing so.

Enter the Codes for already existing objects if you want to use Import as a means to edit and update those objects.
column2:
*Required

Titles are required text fields.  You MUST fill in a Title for all Risks in order to import them.
column4:
*Required.
Map a person to be the Person of Contact for the Risk by entering an email address that already exists in your gGRC instance. Only 1 email address may be entered.

Example:

ken@reciprocitylabs.com
column5:
*Optional.  

You can link gGRC objects to Risks on import by specifying the type and that object's code, separated by a colon.  Use <option><return> to deliniate between object codes.
Example:

System:SYSTEM-1
Standard:PCI-1.2
